author: @harshk2010
text: Hi Guys,   Getting ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'flask_wtf' even though the package is installed in virtual environment. Tried explicitly adding the path  /var/www/FlaskApp/FlaskApp/venv/lib/python3.6 to sys.path but still it is not able to find the module. Have gone through everything on StackOverflow but nothing seems to work. I am able to import flask_wtf in python interpreter inside venv. Please help if anybody faced a similar problem.   pip -V pip 19.0.3 from /var/www/FlaskApp/FlaskApp/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pip (python 3.6)    pip freeze Click==7.0 Flask==1.0.2 Flask-WTF==0.14.2 itsdangerous==1.1.0 Jinja2==2.10 MarkupSafe==1.1.1 mysqlclient==1.4.2.post1 PyMySQL==0.9.3 Werkzeug==0.14.1 WTForms==2.2.1

author: @cest102
text: In case anyone else gets stuck on importing flaskWTF...I'm using pyCharm IDE and it was saying that 'TextField' etc are unresolved references. The fix was this:  from flask_wtf import Form from wtforms import TextField, BooleanField, validators, PasswordField

author: @Janweather
text: Hi Sentdex, it's pip install Flask-WTF, you could use pip search <keyword> if you're unsure how the package is called. I use this allot since the names of the packages are very confusing. Thanks for the tuts.

author: @keonkim8870
text: Pycharm, which is a very smart text editor, recommends me the following. Just to inform. WTForms update: TextField is going away use StringField instead Required() is going away use DataRequired() instead
